title: SELLING THE MILK
content: “O mother,” said Katrina one day, “there goes Jan to town with the milk cart! May I go with him and Rink? Please let me go, mother?” “Yes, Katrina,” said mother, “you may go, but you must take your knitting with you. You can knit as you walk along with Jan beside the milk cart, and when the milk is sold, you may ride home in the cart.” So Katrina ran for her knitting, and soon she was walking along by the side of Jan and Rink. Her ball of yarn was in the big pocket of her apron, and she knit busily as she walked. She was careful not to drop any stitches. When they came to the town, Katrina helped Jan sell the milk. Soon all the milk was sold and the big cans were empty. “Get in the cart, Katrina,” said Jan, “and have a ride home.” “No,” said Katrina, “it is such a warm day, and poor Rink is tired. Just think! He pulled all these heavy milk cans to town!”

book.title: Windmills and wooden shoes
